revised_title: Investigating Periodicity in Terrestrial Magnetism with a 26.67-Day Period
tldr: The author examines the possibility of a 26.67-day periodic change in the Earth's magnetism, which could be related to the rotation of the Sun. The study analyzes hourly measurements of terrestrial magnetic elements over several years, considering the impact of temperature variations and instrument adjustments. The results show that while some patterns exist, they are not strong enough to definitively link the changes to solar rotation.
